> [kaffie](#comment_852_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Reality: genetic variation is a thing. There's no "correct" way of being human. But isn't it odd how it's easy to breed whiteness out of someone, yet for hundreds of thousands of years there's been tons of white people?

It is indeed strange and sad in my opinion how easy it is to breed out European ancestry, what you call "whiteness". I think it is irreversible ... or it will take many thousands if not millions of years if you don't artificially try to re-create an European.

That first quote is from 1925 from Mr. Coudenhove-Kalergi by the way, a mixed-race person himself and the founder and president for 49 years of the Paneuropean Union, the precursor to the European Union.

>There's no "correct" way of being human

Agreed. No group should be targeted genocide.

1559759030_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehE.body:
It's a very lame excuse, the great majority are on these big platforms and if you're being deplatformed you won't be able to reach a great majority of people.

>My theory is that vast majority of people will not even notice the censorship, and eat up the propaganda.

That's the nasty thing about censorship, you won't know what's being taken down. The rules the big governments or companies are setting are purposely vague so they can target whatever they deem worthy to be taken down.

I don't think the biggest threat is quantum computing or breaking of the cryptography, it's very easy to block all Bitcoin nodes and no one will be able to transfer Bitcoin, if it ever becomes illegal which I think it will be in the near future.

> [moor](#comment_129_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): The reason is the large scalability

I'm not @install but I don't think Bitcoin or most popular cryptocurrencies are very scalable either because most blockchains accumulates in size at an too rapid rate.
